intro: Acetosella violacea var. rosea, commonly known as the rose-purple sorrel, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that are typically red-veined and have a slightly succulent texture. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pinkish to rose-colored flowers in spring, which are borne on slender stems. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and unique coloration, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
